result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin Devon Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees FROM 25% prison wages and balance by 6-2-16 or CIVIL JUDGMENT.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin Devon Thomas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devin Devon Thomas in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Devin Devon Thomas in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count ONE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

On motion of the State, Court ordered Count Two:  Dismissed and read in as to sentencing.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of ONE YEAR AND THREE MONTHS, with credit for 71 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is  ONE  YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is THREE MONTHS

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for  the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program..

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, , and supervision fees FROM 25% prison wages and balance by 6-2-16 or CIVIL JUDGMENT.

 Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Devin Devon Thomas not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. LR  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Devin Devon Thomas not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-02-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KOHL'S DEPARTMENT STORE, 5300 S 76TH ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devin Devon Thomas in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Devin Devon Thomas in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Devin Devon Thomas
Current: 2035 North 24th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 01-11-2015)
Prior: 2035 North 24th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
